title: [Academic] Full Stack Web Developer â€“ Food App
descriptions: Design and develop a Food App that includes: searching, filtering, ordering, deleting, editing and creating recipes.
Develop the app using React in the frontend, @toolkit-redux, pure CSS and in the Back developed in Node.js with Express, PostgreSQL Database and Sequelize.

title: [Academic] Front-end Developer - E-commerce
descriptions: Design and develop an Ecommerce App that includes: searches, filtering, ordering, deletion, editing and inventory creation.
Led a working group with scrum and Git-Flow methodologies: to move a project forward.
Implement Log-in with Third Parties (Google, Auth0). Also it was used from Mercadopago its SDK and API

Develop the app using React, Redux, CSS, Styled Components in the Front and in the Back developed in Node.js with Express, PostgreSQL and Sequelize Database, Nodemailer, authorization cookies from the Backend to the Frontend. Using Cloudinary to store products as images online.

title: [Academic] Full Stack Nextjs - Blog
descriptions: This is a project to see how the static Props and static paths works, Later on I prove how dynamic routes works with nextjs

title: Comparison of Static Sites using NEXT JS Vs ASTRO JS
descriptions: Individual project which was carried out to compare Nextjs React Vs Astro-Solidjs. The performance in the images can be evidenced in the repository. Its rapid implementation optimizes development time. However, the static site with astro is much faster to implement. But you have to change certain concepts first think about HTML and CSS

title: Server Side Rendering Nextjs Astrojs
descriptions: Individual project which seeks to understand the differences between Next Js Astrojs@1 to render from the server
